verses.verse: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son. Jehovah<WH3068>, how are mine adversaries<WH6862> increased<WH7231>! Many<WH7227> are they that rise up against me<WH6965>.
Many <WH7227> there are that say<WH559> of my soul<WH5315>, There is no help<WH3444> for him in God<WH430>. <WH5542>[[Selah
But thou<WH3068>, O Jehovah, art a shield<WH4043> about me<WH3519>; My glory and the lifter up<WH7311> of my head<WH7218>.
I cry<WH7121> unto Jehovah<WH3068> with my voice<WH6963>, And he answereth<WH6030> me out of his holy<WH6944> hill<WH2022>. [Selah<WH5542>]
I laid me down<WH7901> and slept<WH3462>; I awaked<WH6974>; For Jehovah<WH3068> sustaineth me<WH5564>.
I will not be afraid<WH3372> of ten thousands<WH7233> of the people<WH5971> That have set<WH7896> themselves against me round about<WH5439>.

Arise <WH6965>, O Jehovah<WH3068>; Save<WH3467> me<WH430>, O my God: For thou hast smitten<WH5221> all mine enemies<WH341> upon the cheek bone<WH3895>; Thou hast broken<WH7665> the teeth<WH8127> of the wicked<WH7563>.
Salvation <WH3444> belongeth unto Jehovah<WH3068>: Thy blessing<WH1293> be upon thy people<WH5971>. [Selah<WH5542>]
